document_title: Overactive bladder: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Overactive bladder or overactive bladder (OAB) is a condition of untimely contractions of the bladder, causing the feeling of frequent, sudden and difficult to control urination. People with overactive bladder feel the need to urinate frequently day and night and may also experience urgency. Therefore, if you have a total number of urination more than 8 times a day or more than 2 times at night, you should think about overactive bladder. (first)
Overactive bladder is not dangerous, but it can make the patient feel self-conscious, affect work and interfere with daily activities. Luckily, overactive bladder can be quickly diagnosed and treated effectively, giving the patient back their confidence.
